articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: China death toll passes 700, American dies of coronavirus in Wuhan
articles.description: The death toll in mainland China surpassed 700 on Saturday, according to authorities, and is poised to pass the 774 deaths recorded globally during the 2002-2003 outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). Lauren Anthony reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
The death toll in mainland China surpassed 700 on Saturday, according to authorities, and is poised to pass the 774 deaths recorded globally during the 2002-2003 outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). Lauren Anthony reports.

articles.description: U.S. electric carmaker Tesla's factory in China's financial hub of Shanghai will resume production on Feb. 10, a Shanghai government official said on Saturday, adding that authorities would provide assistance to the firm.
articles.content:
SHANGHAI (Reuters) - U.S. electric carmaker Tesla’s (TSLA.O) factory in China’s financial hub of Shanghai will resume production on Feb. 10, a Shanghai government official said on Saturday, adding that authorities would provide assistance to the firm.

articles.title: China adds health expert to provincial committee of Communist Party in Hubei
articles.description: China has appointed Wang Hesheng, who has served in the public health system for years, as a member of the provincial committee of the Communist Party in Hubei province, state television reported on Saturday.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Treasury's Mnuchin sees U.S. GDP growth less than 3% in 2020
articles.description: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday he expects 2020 U.S. gross domestic product growth to be less than 3%, partly due to problems at Boeing Co, which halted production of its 737 MAX planes over safety issues.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday he expects 2020 U.S. gross domestic product growth to be less than 3%, partly due to problems at Boeing Co, which halted production of its 737 MAX planes over safety issues.

articles.title: Japan confirms 3 more coronavirus cases on cruise liner; total now 64
articles.description: Another 3 people on a cruise liner off Japan have tested positive for coronavirus, bringing the total number of confirmed cases from the ship to 64, Japan's health ministry said on Saturday.
articles.content:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Another 3 people on a cruise liner off Japan have tested positive for coronavirus, bringing the total number of confirmed cases from the ship to 64, Japan’s health ministry said on Saturday.

articles.title: Pentagon official, Lockheed Martin pull out of Singapore Airshow
articles.description: The Pentagon shrunk the size of its delegation traveling to the Singapore Airshow and U.S. defense firms Lockheed Martin Corp and Raytheon Co said they would not attend, as the impact of the coronavirus has reduced participation in the event.

articles.title: New cases of coronavirus infections rise in China after two-day decline
